Reverberations of Beirut

is a sound installation that brings the echoes of Beirut’s past to a new space. The installation serves as a reminder of the tumultuous history of Beirut and the lasting impact they had on the city and its people. By recreating these experiences in a different setting, the installation invites the audience to reflect on the consequences of conflict and the power of memory. Through sound and touch, “Reverberations of Beirut” creates a space for contemplation and empathy, bridging the gap between past and present.

echo from Wissam Sader on Vimeo.
